snippet: The five accused co-conspirators in the 2001 attacks showed cooperation in the first session of a weeklong pretrial hearing, in sharp contrast to their behavior in a May arraignment.
abstract: Five accused co-conspirators in Sept 11, 2001, attacks cooperate in first session of  week-long pretrial hearing as military commission at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, resumes; Khalid Shaikh Mohammed, self-described mastermind of attacks, and the four other  defendants each speak directly with judge, unlike at chaotic arraignment hearing in May when they refused to answer any questions.
lead_paragraph: The five accused co-conspirators in the 2001 attacks showed cooperation in the first session of a weeklong pretrial hearing, in sharp contrast to their behavior in a May arraignment.

headline.seo: Sept. 11 War-Crimes Case Resumes at Guantánamo Bay
headline.main: Defendants in Sept. 11 Case Cooperate as Proceedings Resume at Guantánamo
headline.print_headline: Defendants in Sept. 11 Case Cooperate as Proceedings Resume at Guantánamo
